thesis.description: The manufacturing industries during the last century have benefited by the introduction of labour saving devices and the application of scientific methods to their processes to such an extent that at present their output is limited only by the demand for the.product manufactured. We have one notable exception in the linen industry. [...]

thesis.description: The object of the work described in this thesis was the development of a technique by means of which specific heats and latent heats at low temperatures could be accurately measured. The theoretical significance of these measurements is discussed first. [...]

thesis.description: The Copper Nickel Ore deposits of the Sudbury district, Ontario, are much larger than any other known nickel-bearing ore bodies in the world, and their richness, relatively uniform character and favorable location as regards markets, warrants the conclusion that the Ontario Nickel industry has little to fear from outside competition. [...]

thesis.description: With the intention of discovering whether the omentum possesses actual phagocytic properties, I undertook, at the suggestion of Professor John Tait, some intraperitoneal injection experiments.It is advisable at this stage to proceed with the examination of the diaphragm, which, along with the ring of cartilage and bone to which it is attached, was excised and immersed in isotonic salt or saooharose solution for examination. [...]

thesis.title: Absorption of Chinese ink and of tubercle bacilli by the omentum.

thesis.description: The following work is intended to show the origin, extent and economic possibilities of a deposit of magnesite in Grenville township in the Province of Quebec. It includes a brief account of the general geology and structural features of the region as well as an advisory statement to guide the operators in the future development of the deposits and a caution to the buyers in selecting their supplies.
thesis.creator: Bain, George W.
thesis.subject: Geological Sciences.
thesis.title: The genesis of the deposits of dolomite and magnesite in Grenville and Chatham Townships, Quebec.

thesis.description: Lubrication in general is without doubt one of the most important phases of modern mechanical engineering. Statiticians have shown that even in our present state of so called Engineering Efficiency over one third of the total power of the world is consumed by friction. [...]

thesis.description: In the study of the history and national life of people, an investigation of their folk-lore lays bare the foundations on which their racial character is based, and the motives to which their position amongst other nations may be ascribed.

English.

thesis.description: An enormous amount of research has been done relative to the theoretical side of the [flotation] process, but nevertheless, there are many phenomena taking place in the ordinary flotation unit, that the present theory fails to adequately explain. In a great number of cases, perhaps in the majority of cases, the results obtained in mill practice are the outcome of empirical trials. This is due in no small degree, to the fact that the theory of flotation is a problem for the physicist, as well as for the chemist and the metallurgist. [...]

thesis.title: The differential flotation of lead, zinc, iron, sulphide ores, employing sub-aeration, i.e. Callow methods, and a comparison of the above with methods based on intermittant mechanical agitation.

thesis.description: The term 'valency' has long been applied to this primordial number of hydrogen atoms which can be held in a stable combination by another atom while 'secondary valency' has been used to imply the power of the molecule to enter into loose combinations in virtue of this stray field of force. [...]

thesis.description: A method for determining the influence of organic compounds on vulcanization is described in a paper published by C. W. Bedford end L. B. Sebrell. thesis.description: The problem of soil acidity is one that is common to most soils of humid regions. A large amount of investigation has been carried on to determine the nature of the phenomenon and to find a satisfactory method for its determination. [...]

thesis.description: Very little has hitherto been published concerning the complex network of dykes found in the vicinity of Mount Royal, and which in their origin are intimately associated with the main intrusive masses of the mountain. Their study, in the past, has been greatly hampered by the lack of adequate exposures, due to the heavy mantle of drift which covers the greater part of this area. [...]

thesis.description: The disease has persisted and has been confused with other diseases of a contagious and infectious nature. The clinical symptoms have indicated forage, arsenic, and strychnine poisoning, blackleg, anthrax, hemorrhagic septicemia, tetanus and "vibrion septique". Early in the outbreak chemical and bacteriological examinations did not assist in determining the causal agent. [...]

thesis.description: The substance of this paper is the result of preliminary studies on the genotypic behaviour of the character hullessness as expressed in a cross between the hulless and the common types of oats. This work has been in progress for four years, and sufficient data has been obtained to introduce the problem and to include the preliminary points necessary in a study of this character. [...]

thesis.description: The study of the interesting phenomena exhibited in the Trenton limestone at its contact with the essexite of Mount Royal has hitherto been hampered by the scarcity of suitable exposures. It is true that such a contact has been exposed in the Corporation (Forsyth) Qyarry, at Outremont for many years but while the petrographical examination of specimens of the metamorphosed rock from this outcrop has indicated the presence of a complex assemblage of contact minerals it has failed to afford a basis for a broad interpretation of the contact phenomena. [...]

thesis.description: The importance which the rubber industry now commands would, it might be supposed, imply a more thorough knowledge than we, in fact, have of its chief raw product. From a practical point of view, knowledge of the constitution of the caoutchouc molecule is less important than information as to the composition of the raw material and the function of its "impurities" in its utilization. It would appear highly desireable to know the chemical nature of the non-caoutchouc constituents, yet very little attention had been given this question. [...]
thesis.creator: Dolid, Jacob.
thesis.subject: Organic Chemistry.
thesis.title: Contributions to the knowledge of the non-caoutchouc constituents of rubber. The resins of hevea brasilensis.

thesis.description: The dimensions and shape of a particular aeroplane are governed by requirements of aerodynamic efficiency, type of service, etc., and are fairly well fixed by practice. When a new design is introduced, however, it must be checked for airworthiness before flying. The object of this paper is to check, in detail, an empirical machine for airworthiness.
thesis.creator: Gliddon, William G.
thesis.subject: Aerodynamics & Engineering.
thesis.title: Aeroplane design ; Investigation into the effects of weather conditions on the friction of sleigh runners on snow.

thesis.description: Beryllium offers a vast field for research. Though not generally recognized to be such, it is a common metal, as later remarks will show. Its position in the periodic table, which for a time was a matter of doubt, ensures that it will possess properties of great interest, since it lies on the border line of the non-metals. [...]

thesis.description: The effect of sulphur on rubber has interested many chemists, both theoretical and practical, since the discovery of vulcanization by Goodyear in 1839. thesis.description: The subject of the diffusion of gases through metals is one that has received comparatively little attention when one considers the number of metals and alloys with which different gases come in contact in various industries. Many of the experiments performed were only qualitative, and most of these which yielded quantitative results have been made in such a manner or with such apparatus that the accuracy of the results is much to be doubted. thesis.description: The experiments to be described below were undertaken to study the effects of high temperature with relative humidity high and relative humidity low, on the body temperature and water content of the blood.
